symptoms.name: Diarrhea
symptoms.pattern: Most common symptom, usually self-limiting, lasting around three days but may last for one week

symptoms.name: Gastroenteritis
symptoms.pattern: Commonly follows ingestion of undercooked seafood

symptoms.name: Other symptoms
symptoms.pattern: May include nausea, vomiting, abdominal cramps

vital_signs.temperature: May be elevated in severe cases
vital_signs.heart_rate: May be elevated in severe cases
vital_signs.blood_pressure: May be affected in severe cases

risk_factors: Consumption of raw or undercooked seafood, especially shellfish (oysters, mussels, clams)

required: Positive stool culture for Vibrio parahaemolyticus
supportive: Symptoms of gastroenteritis (diarrhea, nausea, vomiting, abdominal cramps)
Recent consumption of raw or undercooked seafood
